<APIMethods
  service="staking-api"
  network="polkadot"
  proxy=""
  host="polkadot-slate.datahub.figment.io/api/v1/flows"
  methods={[
    {
      name: "Create New Delegation Flow",
      content:
        'To initiate the staking process, create a new flow with a `POST` request to `/api/v1/flows`.\n\n### Parameters\n\n- `flow` — `object`\n    - `network_code` — `string` Network this flow operates on (ex. `polkadot`) (required).\n    - `chain_code` — `string` Chain this flow operates on (ex. `westend`) (required).\n    - `operation` `string` The operation to perform (ex. `staking`) (required).\n    - `version` — `string` API version to use (ex. `v1`) (optional).\n\n### Response\n\n- `id` — `string` ID of the flow.\n- `operation` — `string` The Staking API operation being performed by this flow.\n- `state` — `string` The current state of the flow.\n- `actions` — `array` It includes the `name` & `inputs` of all next possible actions.\n    - `assign_stash_and_controller_account` — Use this action if you already have a controller account set up and wish to add bond to it.\n        - `create_bonding_tx` — Use this action if you do not have a controller account set up and would like to create a controller and bond tokens.\n        - `controller_account_address` — The wallet to which the DOT will be bonded.\n        - `controller_proxy_account_address` — A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account.\n        - `stash_account_address` — Primary wallet from which DOT will be bonded.\n        - `stash_proxy_account_address` — A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the stash account.\n        - `reward_destination` — Indicates whether rewards are to be:\n            - Added to the staked balance: `Staked`.\n            - Sent to the controller account, liquid: `Controller`.\n            - Sent to the stash account, liquid: `Stash`.\n        - `amount` — The amount of DOT to be bonded to the controller. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (ie. if you want to stake 5 DOT, return `"amount": 5.0`). The Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor.\n- `data` — `object` Delegation flow & transaction data.',
      request: {
        method: "POST",
        header: [],
        body: {
          flow: {
            network_code: "polkadot",
            chain_code: "westend",
            operation: "staking",
            version: "v1",
          },
        },
        url: "https://polkadot-slate.datahub.figment.io",
        headers: {
          Authorization: "",
        },
        query: "api/v1/flows",

    {
      name: "Submit Bonding Transaction Data",
      content:
        'After creating a new staking flow, submit the staking account data. Collect the required inputs. Send a `PUT` request to `/api/v1/flows/[:flow_id]/next` to proceed to the next step.\n\n### Parameters\n\n- `name` — `string` Name of the action to execute (required).\n- `inputs` — `object`\n    - `controller_account_address` — `string` Address of the wallet to which the DOT will be bonded (required).\n    - `controller_proxy_account_address` — `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).\n    - `stash_account_address` — `string` Primary wallet from which DOT will be bonded. Cannot have a zero balance (required).\n    - `stash_proxy_account_address` — `string` A proxy account that will sign on behalf of the controller account (optional).\n    - `reward_destination` — `string` Reward destination (required). Indicates whether rewards are to be:\n        - `Staked` Added to the staked balance.\n        - `Controller` Sent to the controller account, liquid.\n        - `Stash` Sent to the stash account, liquid. Providing the `stash_account_address` is equivalent to using `Stash`.\n    - `amount` — `number` — The amount of DOT to be bonded to the controller. Minimum of `1.0`. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (ie. if you want to stake 5 DOT, return `"amount": 5.0`). Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor (required).\n\n### Response\n\n- `id` — `string` ID of the flow.\n- `operation` — `string` The Staking API operation being performed by this flow.\n- `state` — `string` The current state of the flow.\n- `actions` — `array` It includes the `name` & `inputs` of all next possible actions.\n    - `refresh_bonding_tx` — If you need to get a fresh version of the transaction payload (i.e., the nonce has increased).\n    - `sign_bonding_tx` — Submit a signed transaction payload ready to be broadcast to the network.\n- `data` — `object` Delegation flow & transaction data.',

      content:
        'Bond more tokens between an existing Stash and Controller account. The required input is the `amount`. Send a `PUT` request to `/api/v1/flows/[:flow_id]/next` to proceed to the next step.\n\n### Parameters\n\n- `name` — `string` Name of the action to execute, i.e. `create_bond_more_tx` (required).\n- `inputs` — `object`\n    - `amount` — `number` — The amount of DOT to be bonded to the controller. Minimum of `1.0`. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (ie. if you want to stake 5 DOT, return `"amount": 5.0`). The Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor (required).\n\n### Response\n\n- `id` — `string` ID of the flow.\n- `operation` — `string` The Staking API operation being performed by this flow.\n- `state` — `string` The current state of the flow.\n- `actions` — `array` It includes the `name` & `inputs` of all next possible actions.\n    - `refresh_bond_more_tx` — If you need to get a fresh version of the transaction payload (i.e., the nonce has increased).\n    - `sign_bond_more_tx` — Submit a signed transaction payload ready to be broadcast to the network.\n    - `confirm_bond_more_tx_by_hash` — Submit a valid extrinsic hash and block number to confirm the transaction on-chain.\n- `data` — `object` Delegation flow & transaction data.',

      name: "Create New Undelegation Flow",
      content:
        'To initiate the undelegation process, create a new flow with a `POST` request to `/api/v1/flows`.\n\n- **If chilling is required** before unbonding, the Staking API will indicate that you must create a chill transaction. Proceed to [Create Chill Transaction](/guides/staking-api/polkadot/undelegate/create-unbond-transaction).\n- **If no chilling is required**, you will be presented with an action to create the unbond transaction. Proceed to [Create Unbond Transaction](/guides/staking-api/polkadot/undelegate/create-unbond-transaction).\n- If you want to skip the unbonding process as well, proceed to [Create Withdrawal Transaction](/guides/staking-api/polkadot/undelegate/create-withdraw-transaction).\n    \n\nFrom a newly initialized flow you can either jump right to `create_withdraw_tx` or perform `assign_unstaking_data`.\n\nIf you assign the unstaking data, you may need to create, sign, and broadcast a chill transaction, followed by an unbonding transaction.\n\nAfter unbonding, you can either be done with the flow, or if there is a balance to withdraw, you can create, sign, and broadcast the withdraw transaction.\n\n### Parameters\n\n- `flow` — `object`\n    - `network_code` — `string` Network this flow operates on (ex. `polkadot`) (required).\n    - `chain_code` — `string` Chain this flow operates on (ex. `westend`) (required).\n    - `operation` `string` The operation to perform (ex. `unstaking`) (required).\n    - `version` — `string` API version to use (ex. `v1`) (optional).\n\n### Response\n\n- `id` — `string` ID of the flow.\n- `operation` — `string` The Staking API operation being performed by this flow.\n- `state` — `string` The current state of the flow.\n- `actions` — `array` It includes the `name` & `inputs` of all next possible actions.\n    - `assign_unstaking_data` — Use this action if you want to unbond. Chill first if needed. Optionally used to withdraw.\n        - `stash_account_address` — The wallet DOT is bonded to.\n        - `controller_account_address` — The account that controls the staking/unstaking actions. This is the account that will sign transactions.\n        - `controller_proxy_account_address` (optional) — A proxy account that can sign on behalf of the controller account.\n        - `amount` — The amount of DOT to be unbonded from the controller. This field should be in full DOT, not in Planck (i.e., if you want to stake 5 DOT, return `"amount": 5.0`). The Staking API will translate the amount to Plancks so you do not have to worry about the conversion factor.\n        - `maximum` — This boolean indicates if all bonded funds should be unbonded.\n    - `create_withdraw_tx` — Use this action if you want to withdraw _without_ unbonding.\n- `data` — `object` Undelegation flow & transaction data.',
